taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [For John Herman Sandberg, 1848–1917, Swedish-born American botanist and physician who collected extensively in the Pacific Northwest]

bio:treatment.discussion: Although both species of Sandbergia were placed by R. C. Rollins (1993) in Halimolobos, the two genera are not closely related. Sandbergia is most closely related to Boechera, whereas Halimolobos is sister to Mancoa and Sphaerocardamum Schauer in the tribe Halimolobeae. For an account of the generic boundaries of Sandbergia, see under 60. Halimolobos.

references.reference: Al-Shehbaz, I. A. 2007b. The North American genus Sandbergia (Boechereae, Brassicaceae). Harvard Pap. Bot. 12: 425–427.
